1.sun: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth.  The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.
1.moon: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.
1.name: bulbasaur

2.sun: There is a plant bulb on its back. When it absorbs nutrients, the bulb is said to blossom into a large flower.
2.moon: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet  aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.
2.name: ivysaur

3.sun: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.
3.moon: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells  stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.
3.name: venusaur

50003.sun: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.
50003.moon: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells  stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.
50003.name: mega venusaur

4.sun: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life  force. If it's healthy, the flame burns brightly.
4.moon: From the time is born, a flame burns at the tip of  its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to  go out.
4.name: charmander

5.sun: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe.  It then tears up the fallen opponent with  sharp claws.
5.moon: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to unbearably high levels.
5.name: charmeleon

6.sun: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
6.moon: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
6.name: charizard

50006.sun: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
50006.moon: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
50006.name: mega charizard y

7.sun: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
7.moon: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
7.name: squirtle

8.sun: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
8.moon: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.
8.name: wartortle

9.sun: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
9.moon: The pressurized water jets on this brutal Pokémon's shell are used for high-speed tackles.
9.name: blastoise

50009.sun: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
50009.moon: The pressurized water jets on this brutal Pokémon's shell are used for high-speed tackles.
50009.name: mega blastoise

10.sun: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.
10.moon: It’s easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making it one of the top recommendations for novice Pokémon Trainers.
10.name: caterpie

11.sun: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn’t move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.
11.moon: Its shell is hard, but it’s still just a bug shell. It’s been known to break, so intense battles with it should be avoided.
11.name: metapod

12.sun: Close examination of its large eyes reveals that each eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.
12.moon: When attacked by other Pokémon, it defends itself by scattering its poisonous scales and fluttering its wings.
12.name: butterfree

13.sun: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.
13.moon: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.
13.name: weedle

14.sun: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.
14.moon: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.
14.name: kakuna

15.sun: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
15.moon: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.
15.name: beedrill

50015.sun: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
50015.moon: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.
50015.name: mega beedrill

16.sun: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
16.moon: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.
16.name: pidgey

17.sun: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.
17.moon: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.
17.name: pidgeotto

18.sun: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.
18.moon: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.
18.name: pidgeot

50018.sun: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.
50018.moon: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.
50018.name: mega pidgeot

19.sun: Living wherever there is food available, it ceaselessly scavenges for edibles the entire day.
19.moon: Its fangs are long and very sharp. They grow continuously, so it gnaws on hard things to whittle them down.
19.name: rattata

50019.sun: Living wherever there is food available, it ceaselessly scavenges for edibles the entire day.
50019.moon: Its fangs are long and very sharp. They grow continuously, so it gnaws on hard things to whittle them down.
50019.name: alolan rattata

20.sun: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.
20.moon: The webs on its hind legs enable it to cross rivers. It searches wide areas for food
20.name: raticate

50020.sun: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.
50020.moon: The webs on its hind legs enable it to cross rivers. It searches wide areas for food
50020.name: alolan raticate

21.sun: Its short wings make it inept at flying. It moves about hurriedly and pecks at Bug-type Pokémon in the tall grass.
21.moon: Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug Pokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous appetite and look after it.
21.name: spearow

22.sun: It’s tough and has excellent stamina. It has no problem flying continuously for a whole day carrying a heavy load.
22.moon: Drawings of a Pokémon resembling Fearow can be seen in murals from deep in ancient history.
22.name: fearow

23.sun: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
23.moon: Moving silently and stealthily, it eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.
23.name: ekans

24.sun: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.
24.moon: To intimidate foes, it spreads its chest wide and makes eerie sounds by expelling air from its mouth.
24.name: arbok

25.sun: It raises its tail to check its surroundings.  The tail is sometimes struck by lightning  in this pose.
25.moon: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.
25.name: pikachu

26.sun: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
26.moon: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
26.name: raichu

50026.sun: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
50026.moon: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
50026.name: alolan raichu

27.sun: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.
27.moon: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
27.name: sandshrew

50027.sun: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.
50027.moon: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
50027.name: alolan sandshrew

28.sun: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spikes and claws. They grow back in a day.
28.moon: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
28.name: sandslash

50028.sun: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spikes and claws. They grow back in a day.
50028.moon: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
50028.name: alolan sandslash

29.sun: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
29.moon: Small and very docile, it protects itself with its small, poisonous horn when attacked.
29.name: nidoran female

30.sun: The female has a gentle temperament. It emits ultrasonic cries that have the power to befuddle foes.
30.moon: When feeding its young, it first chews the food into  a paste, then spits it out for the offspring.
30.name: nidorina

31.sun: It uses its scaly, rugged body to seal the entrance of its nest and protect its young from predators.
31.moon: The body is covered by stiff, needlelike scales. If it becomes excited, the needles bristle outwards.
31.name: nidoqueen

32.sun: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.
32.moon: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.
32.name: nidoran male

33.sun: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses anything, it attacks immediately.
33.moon: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.
33.name: nidorino

34.sun: It is recognized by its rock-hard hide and its extended horn. Be careful with the horn, as it contains venom.
34.moon: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.
34.name: nidoking

35.sun: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.
35.moon: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.
35.name: clefairy

36.sun: They don’t like to reveal themselves in front of people. They live quietly in packs deep in the mountains.
36.moon: According to tradition, people who see a pair of Clefable skipping by can look forward to a happy marriage.
36.name: clefable

37.sun: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
37.moon: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
37.name: vulpix

50037.sun: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
50037.moon: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
50037.name: alolan vulpix

38.sun: It has nine long tales and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
38.moon: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
38.name: ninetales

50038.sun: It has nine long tales and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
50038.moon: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
50038.name: alolan ninetales

39.sun: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you’ll become sleepy right away.
39.moon: Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual’s singing skill depends on its own effort.
39.name: jigglypuff

40.sun: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.
40.moon: As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.
40.name: wigglytuff

41.sun: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.
41.moon: When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns. The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can differ slightly from colony to colony.
41.name: zubat

42.sun: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.
42.moon: Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can’t fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and become food for other Pokémon.
42.name: golbat

43.sun: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
43.moon: Its scientific name is “Oddium Wanderus.” At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.
43.name: oddish

44.sun: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
44.moon: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
44.name: gloom

45.sun: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
45.moon: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
45.name: vileplume

46.sun: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.
46.moon: Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its back. They can be dried and powdered to make a medicine used to extend life.
46.name: paras

47.sun: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
47.moon: It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap. Once harvested, these spores can be steeped and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
47.name: parasect

48.sun: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
48.moon: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.
48.name: venonat

49.sun: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.
49.moon: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
49.name: venomoth

50.sun: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
50.moon: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
50.name: diglett

50050.sun: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
50050.moon: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
50050.name: alolan diglett

51.sun: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
51.moon: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
51.name: dugtrio

50051.sun: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
50051.moon: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
50051.name: alolan dugtrio

52.sun: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
52.moon: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
52.name: meowth

50052.sun: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
50052.moon: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
50052.name: alolan meowth

53.sun: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
53.moon: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
53.name: persian

50053.sun: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
50053.moon: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
50053.name: alolan persian

54.sun: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.
54.moon: This Pokémon is troubled by constant headaches. The more pain it’s in, the more powerful its psychokinesis becomes.
54.name: psyduck

55.sun: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
55.moon: It swims along the banks of lakes and catches fish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and quietly eats them up.
55.name: golduck

56.sun: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
56.moon: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.
56.name: mankey

57.sun: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.
57.moon: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
57.name: primeape

58.sun: It’s both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.
58.moon: It looks cute, but when you approach another Trainer’s Growlithe, it will bark at you and bite.
58.name: growlithe

59.sun: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokémon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.
59.moon: The fire burning inside its body serves as the energy to fuel it as it runs great distances. It appears in many legends.
59.name: arcanine

60.sun: The swirl on its belly is its internal organs showing through. If the swirl is tinged white, that means it’s affected by some disease.
60.moon: It’s still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.
60.name: poliwag

61.sun: Although it can live on land, it prefers to stay in the water, where it has fewer natural enemies.
61.moon: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it’s safe.
61.name: poliwhirl

62.sun: Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
62.moon: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.
62.name: poliwrath

63.sun: It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping, it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and eat berries there.
63.moon: It can teleport itself to safety while it’s asleep, but when it wakes, it doesn’t know where it is, so it panics.
63.name: abra

64.sun: A theory exists that this Pokémon was a young boy who couldn’t control his psychic powers and ended up transformed into this Pokémon.
64.moon: Kadabra’s presence infests televisions and monitors with creepy shadows that bring bad luck.
64.name: kadabra

65.sun: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
65.moon: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its IQ (intelligence quotient) is said to be around 5,000.
65.name: alakazam

50065.sun: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
50065.moon: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its IQ (intelligence quotient) is said to be around 5,000.
50065.name: mega alakazam

66.sun: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.
66.moon: With its superhuman strength, it’s able to throw a hundred people all at the same time. Its strength comes from lifting Graveler every day.
66.name: machop

67.sun: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.
67.moon: It willingly assists with hard labor because it knows the work is good training for its muscles.
67.name: machoke

68.sun: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
68.moon: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
68.name: machamp

69.sun: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
69.moon: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary  mandrake plant.
69.name: bellsprout

70.sun: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
70.moon: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy  and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.
70.name: weepinbell

71.sun: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
71.moon: Once ingested into this Pokémon's body,  even the hardest object will melt into nothing.
71.name: victreebel

72.sun: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
72.moon: It drifts in shallow seas, such as the areas near beaches. If you get bitten or stabbed by its toxic tentacles, rush to the hospital.
72.name: tentacool

73.sun: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.
73.moon: Although these Pokémon are rare, when a large outbreak of them occurs, all fish Pokémon disappear from the surrounding sea.
73.name: tentacruel

74.sun: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
74.moon: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of hardness.
74.name: geodude

50074.sun: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
50074.moon: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of hardness.
50074.name: alolan geodude

75.sun: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
75.moon: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
75.name: graveler

50075.sun: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
50075.moon: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
50075.name: alolan graveler

76.sun: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
76.moon: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
76.name: golem

50076.sun: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
50076.moon: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
50076.name: alolan golem

77.sun: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
77.moon: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.
77.name: ponyta

78.sun: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
78.moon: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
78.name: rapidash

79.sun: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn’t really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isn’t particularly bothered.
79.moon: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.
79.name: slowpoke

80.sun: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
80.moon: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
80.name: slowbro

50080.sun: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
50080.moon: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
50080.name: mega slowbro

81.sun: They gather in places where electricity is available. They can be found clinging to the steel towers used to support power lines.
81.moon: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it’s eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.
81.name: magnemite

82.sun: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
82.moon: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
82.name: magneton

83.sun: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.
83.moon: It always walks about with a plant stalk clamped in its beak. The stalk is used for building its nest.
83.name: farfetch'd

84.sun: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
84.moon: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
84.name: doduo

85.sun: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads--even for a second--will get pecked severely.
85.moon: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
85.name: dodrio

86.sun: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
86.moon: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.
86.name: seel

87.sun: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.
87.moon: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
87.name: dewgong

88.sun: Sludge exposed to X-rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.
88.moon: Appears in flithy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
88.name: grimer

50088.sun: Sludge exposed to X-rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.
50088.moon: Appears in flithy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
50088.name: alolan grimer

89.sun: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around  them worse.
89.moon: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
89.name: muk

50089.sun: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around  them worse.
50089.moon: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
50089.name: alolan muk

90.sun: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
90.moon: This Pokémon’s tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.
90.name: shellder

91.sun: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.
91.moon: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon’s shell.
91.name: cloyster

92.sun: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
92.moon: Although Gastly is barely visible, when it’s near, a faint sweet smell lingers.
92.name: gastly

93.sun: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
93.moon: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.
93.name: haunter

94.sun: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.
94.moon: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
94.name: gengar

50094.sun: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.
50094.moon: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
50094.name: mega gengar

95.sun: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
95.moon: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.
95.name: onix

96.sun: A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with Munna and Musharna.
96.moon: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it’s ever eaten.
96.name: drowzee

97.sun: While it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon, people who are in need of a good, sound sleep call it their savior.
97.moon: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.
97.name: hypno

98.sun: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
98.moon: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
98.name: krabby

99.sun: The large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
99.moon: Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers.
99.name: kingler

100.sun: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.
100.moon: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.
100.name: voltorb

101.sun: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."
101.moon: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.
101.name: electrode

102.sun: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.
102.moon: Six of them together form a full-fledged Pokémon. It’s often hunted by Crabrawler, but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.
102.name: exeggcute

103.sun: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.
103.moon: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows  too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
103.name: exeggutor

50103.sun: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.
50103.moon: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows  too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
50103.name: alolan exeggutor

104.sun: When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack it from the air.
104.moon: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.
104.name: cubone

105.sun: It is small and was originally very weak. Its temperament turned ferocious when it began using bones.
105.moon: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
105.name: marowak

50105.sun: It is small and was originally very weak. Its temperament turned ferocious when it began using bones.
50105.moon: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
50105.name: alolan marowak

106.sun: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
106.moon: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
106.name: hitmonlee

107.sun: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.
107.moon: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this Pokémon. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.
107.name: hitmonchan

108.sun: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
108.moon: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.
108.name: lickitung

109.sun: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.
109.moon: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
109.name: koffing

110.sun: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
110.moon: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.
110.name: weezing

111.sun: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.
111.moon: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
111.name: rhyhorn

112.sun: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
112.moon: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
112.name: rhydon

113.sun: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
113.moon: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they’re also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.
113.name: chansey

114.sun: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole  life long.
114.moon: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
114.name: tangela

115.sun: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.
115.moon: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
115.name: kangaskhan

50115.sun: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.
50115.moon: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
50115.name: mega kangaskhan

116.sun: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
116.moon: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
116.name: horsea

117.sun: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.
117.moon: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.
117.name: seadra

118.sun: When the weather grows warm, they form groups and swim upriver. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that spring has arrived.
118.moon: Spellbound by the length of its horn and the beauty of its fins, many strange Trainers raise Goldeen and nothing but Goldeen.
118.name: goldeen

119.sun: When the weather grows cold, its whole body flushes a deep red. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
119.moon: Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided into horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts. The two groups do not get along well.
119.name: seaking

120.sun: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
120.moon: This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.
120.name: staryu

121.sun: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
121.moon: Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract art, led local people to spread rumors that this Pokémon may be an invader from outer space.
121.name: starmie

122.sun: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
122.moon: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.
122.name: mr. mime

123.sun: It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves them with its scythes.
123.moon: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.
123.name: scyther

124.sun: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can  cause people to dance in unison with it.
124.moon: It speaks using a language that sounds human. Research is under way to determine what is being said.
124.name: jynx

125.sun: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.
125.moon: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.
125.name: electabuzz

126.sun: When it’s tired, it leaps into the mouth of a volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
126.moon: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn’t calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.
126.name: magmar

127.sun: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can't tear, it tosses far.
127.moon: It swings its long pincer horns wildly to attack.  During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
127.name: pinsir

50127.sun: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can't tear, it tosses far.
50127.moon: It swings its long pincer horns wildly to attack.  During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
50127.name: mega pinsir

128.sun: Historically, people in areas all over the world have ridden Tauros, but the practice is said to have started in Alola.
128.moon: Although it’s known to be a fierce Pokémon, Tauros in the Alola region are said to possess a measure of calmness.
128.name: tauros

129.sun: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you’ll soon grow tired of seeing them.
129.moon: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokémon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.
129.name: magikarp

130.sun: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.
130.moon: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
130.name: gyarados

50130.sun: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.
50130.moon: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
50130.name: mega gyarados

131.sun: Its high intelligence enables it to comprehend human speech. When it’s in a good mood, it sings in its beautiful voice.
131.moon: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.
131.name: lapras

132.sun: It can reorganize its cells to make itself into a duplicate of anything it sees. The quality of the duplicate depends on the individual.
132.moon: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.
132.name: ditto

133.sun: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.
133.moon: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.
133.name: eevee

134.sun: Its cells are composed of units much like water molecules. It lives close to water and is often mistaken for a mermaid.
134.moon: Blending in with the water and erasing all signs of its presence, it patiently waits for its prey, fish Pokémon.
134.name: vaporeon

135.sun: They send out electrical charges of about 10,000 volts. Because they are high-strung, it can be difficult to grow close to them.
135.moon: When its fur stands on end, that’s a sign it’s about to give off a jolt of electricity. Take care, as sometimes lightning strikes next to it, too.
135.name: jolteon

136.sun: When it catches prey or finds berries, it breathes fire on them until they’re well done, and then it gobbles them up.
136.moon: Its average body temperature is between 1,300 and 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. In its internal flame sac, temperatures reach 3,000 degrees.
136.name: flareon

137.sun: Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created, utilizing the latest technology of the time.
137.moon: It can convert its body into digital data, which enables it to enter cyberspace.
137.name: porygon

138.sun: A prehistoric Pokémon that lived in the primordial sea, it swims by twisting its 10 tentacles about.
138.moon: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokémon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
138.name: omanyte

139.sun: Its tentacles are highly developed as if they are hands and feet. As soon as it ensnares prey, it bites.
139.moon: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.
139.name: omastar

140.sun: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.
140.moon: This Pokémon was regenerated from the fossil of an ancient creature. It protects itself with a hard shell.
140.name: kabuto

141.sun: In the water, it tucks in its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.
141.moon: A slim and fast swimmer. It slices its prey with its sharp sickles and drinks the body fluids.
141.name: kabutops

142.sun: It was regenerated from a dinosaur's genetic matter that was found in amber. It flies with high-pitched cries.
142.moon: This vicious Pokémon is said to have flown in ancient skies while shrieking high-pitched cries.
142.name: aerodactyl

50142.sun: It was regenerated from a dinosaur's genetic matter that was found in amber. It flies with high-pitched cries.
50142.moon: This vicious Pokémon is said to have flown in ancient skies while shrieking high-pitched cries.
50142.name: mega aerodactyl

143.sun: Its stomach is said to be incomparably strong. Even Muk’s poison is nothing more than a hint of spice on Snorlax’s tongue.
143.moon: It eats nearly 900 pounds of food every day. It starts nodding off while eating—and continues to eat even while it’s asleep.
143.name: snorlax

144.sun: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.
144.moon: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
144.name: articuno

145.sun: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.
145.moon: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in  thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.
145.name: zapdos

146.sun: It is said to be the legendary bird Pokémon of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flare of flames.
146.moon: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.
146.name: moltres

147.sun: It grows by molting repeatedly. Boots made from the tanned cast-off skin are a super luxury item.
147.moon: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.
147.name: dratini

148.sun: It has long been thought that its crystalline orbs are imbued with the power to control the weather.
148.moon: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.
148.name: dragonair

149.sun: This Pokémon saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote island—a paradise occupied solely by Dragonite.
149.moon: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it’s satisfied.
149.name: dragonite

150.sun: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.
150.moon: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.
150.name: mewtwo

50150.sun: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.
50150.moon: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.
50150.name: mega mewtwo y

151.sun: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.
151.moon: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.
151.name: mew

152.sun: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up sunrays.
152.moon: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.
152.name: chikorita

153.sun: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.
153.moon: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.
153.name: bayleef

154.sun: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.
154.moon: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.
154.name: meganium

155.sun: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
155.moon: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.
155.name: cyndaquil

156.sun: Before battle, it turns its back on its opponent to demonstrate how ferociously its fire blazes
156.moon: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
156.name: quilava

157.sun: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.
157.moon: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.
157.name: typhlosion

158.sun: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.
158.moon: Its powerful, well-developed jaws are capable of crushing anything. Even its Trainer must be careful.
158.name: totodile

159.sun: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.
159.moon: Once it bites down, it won't let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.
159.name: croconaw

160.sun: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.
160.moon: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
160.name: feraligatr

161.sun: When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.
161.moon: It stands on its tail so it can see a long way. If it spots an enemy, it cries loudly to warn its kind.
161.name: sentret

162.sun: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.
162.moon: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.
162.name: furret

163.sun: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.
163.moon: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
163.name: hoothoot

164.sun: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
164.moon: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
164.name: noctowl

165.sun: They are timid and grow uneasy when not in a swarm with others of their kind. The pattern on their backs differs slightly from one to another.
165.moon: They communicate with one another using bodily fluids that give off odors. When they’re angry, their odor smells sour.
165.name: ledyba

166.sun: While it’s believed that starlight provides it with energy, this Pokémon also loves to eat berries. In the daytime, it curls up in the grass to sleep.
166.moon: In battle, it throws punches with all four arms. The power of each individual blow is piddly, so it aims to win by quantity rather than quality.
166.name: ledian

167.sun: It waits intently until its preferred prey, Cutiefly, gets caught in its web. In fact, it’s quite a patient Pokémon.
167.moon: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.
167.name: spinarak

168.sun: There are some areas where people use the string Ariados spins for their own weaving. The resulting cloth is popular for its strength.
168.moon: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.
168.name: ariados

169.sun: Both its legs became wings, and as a result, it can’t move well on the ground. All it can do is crawl around.
169.moon: Silent and swift in its four-winged flight, it bites down on its prey before they realize what’s happening. In a heartbeat, it drains their blood.
169.name: crobat

170.sun: Its two antennae were originally fins. It discharges electricity to stun its prey before attacking.
170.moon: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.
170.name: chinchou

171.sun: Should you peer into the ocean at night and see a light shining like the stars, that is Lanturn.
171.moon: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
171.name: lanturn

172.sun: It is not yet skilled at controlling electricity. If you take your eyes off it, it may shock itself.
172.moon: Despite this Pokémon’s cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.
172.name: pichu

173.sun: On late nights illuminated by shooting stars, it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of its home.
173.moon: Because of its silhouette, it’s believed to be a star reborn. For some reason, it loves Minior.
173.name: cleffa

174.sun: It likes to sing but is not yet good at it. With praise and encouragement, it will get better little by little.
174.moon: It moves by bouncing along. As it moves a lot, it sweats, and its body gives off a sweet aroma.
174.name: igglybuff

175.sun: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
175.moon: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.
175.name: togepi

176.sun: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.
176.moon: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
176.name: togetic

177.sun: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
177.moon: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
177.name: natu

178.sun: Once it begins to meditate at sunrise, the entire day will pass before it will move again.
178.moon: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
178.name: xatu

179.sun: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.
179.moon: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.
179.name: mareep

180.sun: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
180.moon: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity,  its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
180.name: flaaffy

181.sun: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
181.moon: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from  far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
181.name: ampharos

50181.sun: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
50181.moon: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from  far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
50181.name: mega ampharos

182.sun: Bellossom gather at times and seem to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
182.moon: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.
182.name: bellossom

183.sun: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry, even when it plays in the water.
183.moon: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.
183.name: marill

184.sun: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of living things on riverbeds.
184.moon: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.
184.name: azumarill

185.sun: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.
185.moon: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It’s a particular favorite among elderly people.
185.name: sudowoodo

186.sun: They gather on moonlit nights to form a large chorus. Their cries sound angry and not at all pleasant, but they are certainly distinctive.
186.moon: It’s the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl. When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.
186.name: politoed

187.sun: Its body is so light, it must grip the ground firmly with its feet to keep from being blown away.
187.moon: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.
187.name: hoppip

188.sun: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.
188.moon: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
188.name: skiploom

189.sun: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
189.moon: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.
189.name: jumpluff

190.sun: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
190.moon: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
190.name: aipom

191.sun: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.
191.moon: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.
191.name: sunkern

192.sun: As the hot season approaches, the petals on this Pokémon's face become more vivid and lively.
192.moon: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.
192.name: sunflora

193.sun: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won't miss prey--even those behind it.
193.moon: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
193.name: yanma

194.sun: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
194.moon: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.
194.name: wooper

195.sun: It has a sluggish nature. It lies at the river's bottom, waiting for prey to stray into its mouth.
195.moon: This carefree Pokémon has an easygoing nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.
195.name: quagsire

196.sun: It can instantaneously sense its opponent’s movements by feeling air currents with its fine fur.
196.moon: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.
196.name: espeon

197.sun: When this Pokémon becomes angry, its pores secrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at its opponent’s eyes.
197.moon: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokémon goes for its throat, and then eats it.
197.name: umbreon

198.sun: They awaken at dusk and take wing in the twilight, leading to the expression, “Get home before the Murkrow fly.”
198.moon: Seen as a symbol of bad luck, it’s generally disliked. Yet it gives presents—objects that sparkle or shine—to Trainers it’s close to.
198.name: murkrow

199.sun: A poisonous bite reacted with its system, blessing it with the enhanced intellect of a genius. It has full control of its psychic powers.
199.moon: This Pokémon is so famed for its intellect that a proverb still persists in some regions: “When in doubt, ask Slowking.”
199.name: slowking

200.sun: It will use any means necessary to frighten people and absorb their life energy. It practices constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.
200.moon: If you hear a sobbing sound emanating from a vacant room, it’s undoubtedly a bit of mischief from Misdreavus.
200.name: misdreavus

201.sun: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.
201.moon: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
201.name: unown a

50201.sun: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.
50201.moon: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
50201.name: unown ?

202.sun: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.
202.moon: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
202.name: wobbuffet

203.sun: While it sleeps, the head on is tail keeps watch. The tail doesn't need to sleep.
203.moon: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.
203.name: girafarig

204.sun: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.
204.moon: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.
204.name: pineco

205.sun: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.
205.moon: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
205.name: forretress

206.sun: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
206.moon: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
206.name: dunsparce

207.sun: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
207.moon: It flies straight at its target's face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.
207.name: gligar

208.sun: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.
208.moon: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.
208.name: steelix

50208.sun: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.
50208.moon: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.
50208.name: mega steelix

209.sun: Despite its intimidating face, it’s quite cowardly. Its desperate attempts to appear threatening make it popular with people.
209.moon: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.
209.name: snubbull

210.sun: Its well-developed lower jaw and heavy fangs are its weapons. As long as it’s not provoked, it rarely bites.
210.moon: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.
210.name: granbull

211.sun: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.
211.moon: The small spikes covering its body developed from scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.
211.name: qwilfish

212.sun: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object it gets ahold of into bits.
212.moon: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.
212.name: scizor

50212.sun: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object it gets ahold of into bits.
50212.moon: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.
50212.name: mega scizor

213.sun: The berries stored in its jar-like shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.
213.moon: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
213.name: shuckle

214.sun: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.
214.moon: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
214.name: heracross

50214.sun: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.
50214.moon: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
50214.name: mega heracross

215.sun: It has a cunning yet savage disposition. It waits for parents to leave their nests, and then it sneaks in to steal their eggs.
215.moon: It uses its claws to poke holes in eggs so it can slurp out the insides. Breeders consider it a scourge and will drive it away or eradicate it.
215.name: sneasel

216.sun: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they're soaked with honey.
216.moon: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.
216.name: teddiursa

217.sun: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.
217.moon: Although it has a large body, it is quite skilled at  climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.
217.name: ursaring

218.sun: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.
218.moon: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.
218.name: slugma

219.sun: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.
219.moon: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.
219.name: magcargo

220.sun: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.
220.moon: If it smells something enticing, it dashes off headlong to find the source of the aroma.
220.name: swinub

221.sun: Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves prevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.
221.moon: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.
221.name: piloswine

222.sun: Coral branches grow from its head. They break off quite easily, but they grow back in about three days.
222.moon: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokémon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.
222.name: corsola

223.sun: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike moving prey from more than 300 feet away.
223.moon: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a  Mantine's underside to scavenge for leftovers.
223.name: remoraid

224.sun: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them  before attacking.
224.moon: It traps foes with the suction cups on its tentacles,  then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
224.name: octillery

225.sun: Although it naturally prefers colder locales, Delibird in Alola seem able to withstand the heat to a certain extent.
225.moon: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging around for more food.
225.name: delibird

226.sun: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can fly over 300 feet out of the water from the surface of the ocean.
226.moon: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores  Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.
226.name: mantine

227.sun: Its feathers, which fall off as it grows, are thin and sharp. In times long past, warriors used them as swords.
227.moon: Its metal body is sturdy, but it does rust rather easily. So on rainy days, this Pokémon prefers to stay put in its nest.
227.name: skarmory

228.sun: Around dawn, its ominous howl echoes through the area to announce that this is its territory.
228.moon: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.
228.name: houndour

229.sun: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.
229.moon: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins.  If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.
229.name: houndoom

50229.sun: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.
50229.moon: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins.  If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.
50229.name: mega houndoom

230.sun: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.
230.moon: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life-forms can survive.
230.name: kingdra

231.sun: As a sign of affection, it bumps with its snout. However, it is so strong, it may send you flying.
231.moon: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.
231.name: phanpy

232.sun: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its Tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.
232.moon: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow,
232.name: donphan

233.sun: For the purposes of planetary development, Porygon was updated with the most cutting-edge technology available.
233.moon: Porygon was updated to a new version in readiness for planetary development. But that dream remains unrealized as yet.
233.name: porygon 2

234.sun: Staring at its antlers creates an odd sensation as if one were being drawn into their centers.
234.moon: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.
234.name: stantler

235.sun: The unique creations produced by each Smeargle are painted using the fluid that oozes from its tail. This is how it marks its territory.
235.moon: It draws symbols all over the place to mark its territory. In towns with many Smeargle, the walls are covered in graffiti.
235.name: smeargle

236.sun: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.
236.moon: To brush up on its fighting skills, it will challenge anyone. It has a very strong competitive spirit.
236.name: tyrogue

237.sun: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by 10.
237.moon: If you are enchanted by its smooth, dance-like kicks, you may get a closer experience with one than you'd like.
237.name: hitmontop

238.sun: Its lips are the most sensitive part of its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.
238.moon: It tests everything by touching with its lips, which remember what it likes and dislikes.
238.name: smoochum

239.sun: When it’s in a house, electrical outlets serve as its baby bottles. It sucks down electricity.
239.moon: This Pokémon is constantly fighting with Togedemaru that try to steal its electricity. It’s a pretty even match.
239.name: elekid

240.sun: Many of these Pokémon can be seen in areas with volcanic activity. Feeding can get them so excited, they exhale flames of 1,100 degrees F.
240.moon: A famous potter lives with a Magby. Apparently its soft flames produce fine works.
240.name: magby

241.sun: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltank’s.
241.moon: Most people raise it for its milk, but it’s quite tough and strong, so it’s also well suited for battle.
241.name: miltank

242.sun: Even the most ferocious Pokémon become calm when they eat Blissey’s egg, which is said to be filled with happiness.
242.moon: Its fluffy fur coat acts as a sensor, enabling it to read the feelings of people and Pokémon.
242.name: blissey

243.sun: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.
243.moon: This rough Pokémon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity
243.name: raikou

244.sun: A Pokémon that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.
244.moon: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.
244.name: entei

245.sun: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.
245.moon: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.
245.name: suicune

246.sun: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it falls asleep so it can grow.
246.moon: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.
246.name: larvitar

247.sun: Its body is as hard as bedrock. By venting pressurized gas, it can launch itself like a rocket.
247.moon: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
247.name: pupitar

248.sun: In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.
248.moon: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries  rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.
248.name: tyranitar

50248.sun: In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.
50248.moon: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries  rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.
50248.name: mega tyranitar

249.sun: It sleeps in a deep-sea trench. If it flaps its wings, it is said to cause a 40-day storm.
249.moon: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.
249.name: lugia

250.sun: A legend says that its body glows in seven colors. A rainbow is said to form behind it when it flies.
250.moon: It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by shining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.
250.name: ho-oh

251.sun: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.
251.moon: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.
251.name: celebi

252.sun: It quickly scales even vertical walls. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next day's weather.
252.moon: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.
252.name: treecko

253.sun: Its strongly developed thigh muscles give it astounding agility and jumping performance.
253.moon: It leaps from tree branch to tree branch quite swiftly. It shows astounding agility.
253.name: grovyle

254.sun: The leaves on its forelegs are as sharp as swords. It agilely leaps about the branches of trees to strike.
254.moon: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.
254.name: sceptile

50254.sun: The leaves on its forelegs are as sharp as swords. It agilely leaps about the branches of trees to strike.
50254.moon: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.
50254.name: mega sceptile

255.sun: It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually burns. It feels warm if hugged.
255.moon: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
255.name: torchic

256.sun: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp creis to intimidate foes.
256.moon: During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.
256.name: combusken

257.sun: It can clear a 30-story building in a leap. Its fiery punches scorch its foes.
257.moon: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs it jump clear over buildings.
257.name: blaziken

50257.sun: It can clear a 30-story building in a leap. Its fiery punches scorch its foes.
50257.moon: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs it jump clear over buildings.
50257.name: mega blaziken

258.sun: Its large tail fin propels it through water with powerful acceleration. It is strong in spite of its size.
258.moon: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
258.name: mudkip

259.sun: It is at its best when on muddy ground with poor footing. It quickly overwhelms foes struggling in mud.
259.moon: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.
259.name: marshtomp

260.sun: Its arms are rock-hard. With one swing, they can batter down its foe. It makes its nest on beautiful beaches.
260.moon: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.
260.name: swampert

50260.sun: Its arms are rock-hard. With one swing, they can batter down its foe. It makes its nest on beautiful beaches.
50260.moon: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.
50260.name: mega swampert

261.sun: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.
261.moon: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.
261.name: poochyena

262.sun: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.
262.moon: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.
262.name: mightyena

263.sun: It walks in zigzag fashion. It's good at finding items in the grass and even in the ground.
263.moon: A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an interest in everything, so it always zigzags.
263.name: zigzagoon

264.sun: When running in a straight line, it can easily top 60 miles an hour. It has a tough time with curved roads.
264.moon: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
264.name: linoone

265.sun: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a Starly, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.
265.moon: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.
265.name: wurmple

266.sun: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
266.moon: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.
266.name: silcoon

267.sun: Vibrantly patterned wings are its prominent feature. It sucks sweet flower nectar with its long mouth.
267.moon: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.
267.name: beautifly

268.sun: Its body, which is made of soft silk, hardens over time. When cracks appear, evolution is near.
268.moon: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.
268.name: cascoon

269.sun: A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by streetlights, they messily eat the leaves of trees lining boulevards.
269.moon: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.
269.name: dustox

270.sun: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can't swim.
270.moon: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
270.name: lotad

271.sun: It lives at the water's edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water-grass by day and becomes active at night.
271.moon: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler,  it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.
271.name: lombre

272.sun: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can't help breaking out into a dance.
272.moon: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates  Ludicolo's cells, making it more powerful.
272.name: ludicolo

273.sun: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
273.moon: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
273.name: seedot

274.sun: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.
274.moon: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.
274.name: nuzleaf

275.sun: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe's mind and take preemptive action.
275.moon: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 feet per second that can level houses.
275.name: shiftry

276.sun: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.
276.moon: It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to other lands in search of warmth, flying over 180 miles a day.
276.name: taillow

277.sun: If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is proof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.
277.moon: It dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. It catches its prey with sharp claws.
277.name: swellow

278.sun: Its hollow bones enhance its lightness. It spreads its wings to the wind and soars away into the sky.
278.moon: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they’re circling, the ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokémon.
278.name: wingull

279.sun: Its spacious beak is large enough for a small child to fit right inside.
279.moon: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.
279.name: pelipper

280.sun: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or  Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
280.moon: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and  Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
280.name: ralts

281.sun: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for  its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances  when happy.
281.moon: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the  space around it and see into the future.
281.name: kirlia

282.sun: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.
282.moon: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
282.name: gardevoir

50282.sun: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.
50282.moon: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
50282.name: mega gardevoir

283.sun: It moves as if skating on the surface of the water. It often fights with Dewpider over food.
283.moon: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its head. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.
283.name: surskit
