578.sun: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
578.moon: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
578.name: duosion

579.sun: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
579.moon: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
579.name: reuniclus

580.sun: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
580.moon: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they  dive underwater.
580.name: ducklett

581.sun: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
581.moon: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
581.name: swanna

582.sun: Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.
582.moon: It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This Pokémon is treasured by households in warm regions.
582.name: vanillite

583.sun: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.
583.moon: This Pokémon has existed since the Ice Age. It controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents, and then shatters them with a headbutt.
583.name: vanillish

584.sun: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.
584.moon: Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds inside its body.
584.name: vanilluxe

585.sun: Their coloring changes according to the season and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
585.moon: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
585.name: deerling

586.sun: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns
586.moon: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
586.name: sawsbuck

587.sun: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.
587.moon: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.
587.name: emolga

588.sun: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
588.moon: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
588.name: karrablast

589.sun: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
589.moon: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
589.name: escavalier

590.sun: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
590.moon: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.
590.name: foongus

591.sun: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
591.moon: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
591.name: amoonguss

592.sun: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
592.moon: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
592.name: frillish

593.sun: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
593.moon: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent's habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
593.name: jellicent

594.sun: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.
594.moon: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
594.name: alomomola

595.sun: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
595.moon: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
595.name: joltik

596.sun: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
596.moon: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
596.name: galvantula

597.sun: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
597.moon: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
597.name: ferroseed

598.sun: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
598.moon: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
598.name: ferrothorn

599.sun: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
599.moon: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
599.name: klink

600.sun: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feeling to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
600.moon: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.
600.name: klang

601.sun: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
601.moon: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
601.name: klinklang

602.sun: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
602.moon: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
602.name: tynamo

603.sun: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
603.moon: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
603.name: eelektrik

604.sun: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
604.moon: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
604.name: eelektross

605.sun: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent's brain, causing unendurable headaches.
605.moon: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
605.name: elgyem

606.sun: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.
606.moon: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.
606.name: beheeyem

607.sun: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.
607.moon: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
607.name: litwick

608.sun: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
608.moon: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.
608.name: lampent

609.sun: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
609.moon: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
609.name: chandelure

610.sun: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
610.moon: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
610.name: axew

611.sun: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
611.moon: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
611.name: fraxure

612.sun: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
612.moon: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
612.name: haxorus

613.sun: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
613.moon: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthly, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
613.name: cubchoo

614.sun: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
614.moon: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
614.name: beartic

615.sun: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
615.moon: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.
615.name: cryogonal

616.sun: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.
616.moon: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.
616.name: shelmet

617.sun: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
617.moon: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
617.name: accelgor

618.sun: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
618.moon: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.
618.name: stunfisk

619.sun: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.
619.moon: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
619.name: mienfoo

620.sun: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot ever be seen.
620.moon: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.
620.name: mienshao

621.sun: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
621.moon: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
621.name: druddigon

622.sun: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
622.moon: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.
622.name: golett

623.sun: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.
623.moon: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
623.name: golurk

624.sun: Blades comprise this Pokémon's entire body.  If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
624.moon: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
624.name: pawniard

625.sun: The pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
625.moon: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
625.name: bisharp

626.sun: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
626.moon: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
626.name: bouffalant

627.sun: They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
627.moon: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.
627.name: rufflet

628.sun: With its brave disposition, it fears nothing—not even death. Ancient Alolan people respected it, referring to it as “the hero of the sky.”
628.moon: It’s thought that people disturbed their habitats in the past, so Braviary banded together to fight back.
628.name: braviary

629.sun: It protects its plump posterior with the bones of prey it has consumed. As it grows, it  replaces the bones.
629.moon: It can’t fly yet and must wait until its wings have developed more. Since it’s still at a playful age, it hops around friskily.
629.name: vullaby

630.sun: They adorn themselves beautifully with bones. This is supposedly an effort to attract males, but no male Mandibuzz have ever been found.
630.moon: It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for Pokémon in a weakened state. Its choicest food is Cubone.
630.name: mandibuzz

631.sun: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.
631.moon: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
631.name: heatmor

632.sun: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
632.moon: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
632.name: durant

633.sun: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds
633.moon: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
633.name: deino

634.sun: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
634.moon: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
634.name: zweilous

635.sun: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
635.moon: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
635.name: hydreigon

636.sun: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
636.moon: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.
636.name: larvesta

637.sun: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.
637.moon: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.
637.name: volcarona

638.sun: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
638.moon: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.
638.name: cobalion

639.sun: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.
639.moon: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.
639.name: terrakion

640.sun: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.
640.moon: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.
640.name: virizion

641.sun: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
641.moon: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
641.name: tornadus incarnate

50641.sun: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
50641.moon: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
50641.name: tornadus therian

642.sun: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
642.moon: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
642.name: thundurus incarnate

50642.sun: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
50642.moon: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
50642.name: thundurus therian

643.sun: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
643.moon: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.
643.name: reshiram

644.sun: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
644.moon: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
644.name: zekrom

645.sun: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields."
645.moon: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
645.name: landorus incarnate

50645.sun: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields."
50645.moon: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
50645.name: landorus therian

646.sun: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
646.moon: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
646.name: kyurem

50646.sun: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
50646.moon: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
50646.name: kyurem white

647.sun: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
647.moon: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.
647.name: keldeo

648.sun: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.
648.moon: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
648.name: meloetta aria

50648.sun: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.
50648.moon: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
50648.name: meloetta pirouette

649.sun: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
649.moon: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
649.name: genesect

650.sun: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
650.moon: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn't faze it.
650.name: chespin

651.sun: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators' attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
651.moon: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights.
651.name: quilladin

652.sun: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
652.moon: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
652.name: chesnaught

653.sun: Eating a twig fills it with energy,  and its roomy ears give vent to air  hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
653.moon: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
653.name: fennekin

654.sun: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With  friction from its tail fur, it sets the  twig on fire and launches into battle.
654.moon: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
654.name: braixen

655.sun: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
655.moon: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
655.name: delphox

656.sun: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
656.moon: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
656.name: froakie

657.sun: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
657.moon: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.
657.name: frogadier

658.sun: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
658.moon: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
658.name: greninja

50658.sun: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
50658.moon: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
50658.name: greninja ash

659.sun: They use their large ears to dig burrows.  They will dig the whole night through.
659.moon: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.
659.name: bunnelby

660.sun: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
660.moon: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it's finished digging, it lounges lazily.
660.name: diggersby

661.sun: This amiable Pokémon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side.
661.moon: When it’s excited, its temperature can double, spiking hormone production in its body.
661.name: fletchling

662.sun: From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once it has caught them, it grills them at high heat before feasting upon them.
662.moon: It will not tolerate other Fletchinder entering its territory, which has a radius of several miles.
662.name: fletchinder

663.sun: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.
663.moon: It zooms directly at its prey at flight speeds of close to 310 mph, while fiery embers scatter from gaps in its feathers.
663.name: talonflame

664.sun: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.
664.moon: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
664.name: scatterbug

665.sun: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur  covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
665.moon: The beaks of bird Pokémon can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
665.name: spewpa

666.sun: Vivillon with many different patterns are  found all over the world. These patterns  are affected by the climate of their habitat.
666.moon: The patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
666.name: vivillon

667.sun: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.
667.moon: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.
667.name: litleo

668.sun: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
668.moon: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.
668.name: pyroar

669.sun: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.
669.moon: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.
669.name: flabebe

670.sun: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
670.moon: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
670.name: floette

50670.sun: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
50670.moon: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
50670.name: floette eternal

671.sun: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
671.moon: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.
671.name: florges

672.sun: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
672.moon: If it has sunshine and water, it doesnt need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
672.name: skiddo

673.sun: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
673.moon: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
673.name: gogoat

674.sun: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.
674.moon: There’s no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It’s mischievous, so it’s not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.
674.name: pancham

675.sun: It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoro’s Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.
675.moon: From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it deduces its opponent’s movements. It’s eager to tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.
675.name: pangoro

676.sun: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes  it more elegant but also increases the  swiftness of its movements.
676.moon: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.
676.name: furfrou

677.sun: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
677.moon: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.
677.name: espurr

678.sun: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
678.moon: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.
678.name: meowstic male

50678.sun: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
50678.moon: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.
50678.name: meowstic female

679.sun: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
679.moon: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.
679.name: honedge

680.sun: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
680.moon: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.
680.name: doublade

681.sun: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.
681.moon: Apparently, it can detect innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.
681.name: aegislash shield

50681.sun: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.
50681.moon: Apparently, it can detect innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.
50681.name: aegislash blade

682.sun: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragance changes depending on what it has eaten.
682.moon: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.
682.name: spritzee

683.sun: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
683.moon: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.
683.name: aromatisse

684.sun: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes  white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
684.moon: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.
684.name: swirlix

685.sun: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
685.moon: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human's, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It's like it can see with its nose!
685.name: slurpuff

686.sun: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the  light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.
686.moon: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
686.name: inkay

687.sun: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
687.moon: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.
687.name: malamar

688.sun: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
688.moon: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat  seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.
688.name: binacle

689.sun: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
689.moon: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.
689.name: barbaracle

690.sun: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
690.moon: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.
690.name: skrelp

691.sun: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
691.moon: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.
691.name: dragalge

692.sun: They knock down flying prey by firing  compressed water from their massive  claws like shooting a pistol.
692.moon: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.
692.name: clauncher

693.sun: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
693.moon: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.
693.name: clawitzer

694.sun: They make their home in deserts. They can  generate their energy from basking in the sun,  so eating food is not a requirement.
694.moon: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.
694.name: helioptile

695.sun: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
695.moon: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.
695.name: heliolisk

696.sun: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
696.moon: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
696.name: tyrunt

697.sun: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
697.moon: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.
697.name: tyrantrum

698.sun: This ancient Pokémon was restored  from part of its body that had been  frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
698.moon: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
698.name: amaura

699.sun: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
699.moon: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack.
699.name: aurorus

700.sun: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
700.moon: When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.
700.name: sylveon

701.sun: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
701.moon: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
701.name: hawlucha

702.sun: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and  receiving electrical waves, it can communicate  with others over vast distances.
702.moon: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
702.name: dedenne

703.sun: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
703.moon: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
703.name: carbink

704.sun: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it’s unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
704.moon: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.
704.name: goomy

705.sun: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.
705.moon: This Pokémon’s mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they’re nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.
705.name: sliggoo

706.sun: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
706.moon: It gets picked on because it’s meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.
706.name: goodra

707.sun: This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into people’s homes to steal their keys.
707.moon: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.
707.name: klefki

708.sun: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
708.moon: According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.
708.name: phantump

709.sun: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
709.moon: Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell.
709.name: trevenant

710.sun: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
710.moon: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
710.name: pumpkaboo small

50710.sun: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
50710.moon: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
50710.name: pumpkaboo super

711.sun: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
711.moon: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
711.name: gourgeist small

50711.sun: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
50711.moon: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
50711.name: gourgeist super

712.sun: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
712.moon: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
712.name: bergmite

713.sun: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
713.moon: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.
713.name: avalugg

714.sun: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
714.moon: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
714.name: noibat

715.sun: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
715.moon: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
715.name: noivern

716.sun: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
716.moon: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
716.name: xerneas

717.sun: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
717.moon: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
717.name: yveltal

718.sun: When the Kalos region's ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
718.moon: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
718.name: zygarde 50% 50 normal

50718.sun: When the Kalos region's ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
50718.moon: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
50718.name: zygarde complete 100% 100

719.sun: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
719.moon: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
719.name: diancie

50719.sun: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
50719.moon: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
50719.name: mega diancie

720.sun: It gathers things it likes and pushes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.
720.moon: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space
720.name: hoopa confined

50720.sun: It gathers things it likes and pushes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.
50720.moon: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space
50720.name: hoopa unbound

721.sun: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
721.moon: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
721.name: volcanion

722.sun: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
722.moon: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
722.name: rowlet

723.sun: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
723.moon: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
723.name: dartrix

724.sun: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
724.moon: Although basically cool and cautious, when it’s caught by surprise, it’s seized by panic.
724.name: decidueye

725.sun: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
725.moon: It doesn’t allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.
725.name: litten

726.sun: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
726.moon: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
726.name: torracat

727.sun: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.
727.moon: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.
727.name: incineroar

728.sun: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.
728.moon: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
728.name: popplio

729.sun: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
729.moon: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.
729.name: brionne

730.sun: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
730.moon: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon’s Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.
730.name: primarina

731.sun: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
731.moon: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.
731.name: pikipek

732.sun: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
732.moon: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.
732.name: trumbeak

733.sun: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
733.moon: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
733.name: toucannon

734.sun: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
734.moon: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.
734.name: yungoos

735.sun: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.
735.moon: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it’s diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.
735.name: gumshoos

736.sun: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
736.moon: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.
736.name: grubbin

737.sun: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
737.moon: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.
737.name: charjabug

738.sun: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
738.moon: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.
738.name: vikavolt

739.sun: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
739.moon: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.
739.name: crabrawler

740.sun: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
740.moon: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.
740.name: crabominable

741.sun: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
741.moon: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.
741.name: oricorio

742.sun: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
742.moon: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
742.name: cutiefly

743.sun: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
743.moon: Some of Ribombee’s pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
743.name: ribombee

744.sun: It’s considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
744.moon: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer’s side.
744.name: rockruff

745.sun: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
745.moon: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.
745.name: lycanroc midday

50745.sun: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
50745.moon: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.
50745.name: lycanroc dusk

746.sun: When itâ€™s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
746.moon: Itâ€™s awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.
746.name: wishiwashi solo

50746.sun: When itâ€™s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
50746.moon: Itâ€™s awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.
50746.name: wishiwashi school

747.sun: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
747.moon: It’s found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola’s head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.
747.name: mareanie

748.sun: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
748.moon: Those attacked by Toxapex’s poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.
748.name: toxapex

749.sun: The mud stuck to Mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
749.moon: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.
749.name: mudbray

750.sun: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
750.moon: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.
750.name: mudsdale

751.sun: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
751.moon: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.
751.name: dewpider

752.sun: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
752.moon: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.
752.name: araquanid

753.sun: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
753.moon: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.
753.name: fomantis

754.sun: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
754.moon: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.
754.name: lurantis

755.sun: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
755.moon: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
755.name: morelull

756.sun: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
756.moon: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.
756.name: shiinotic

757.sun: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
757.moon: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.
757.name: salandit

758.sun: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
758.moon: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.
758.name: salazzle

759.sun: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
759.moon: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It’s an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.
759.name: stufful

760.sun: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
760.moon: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.
760.name: bewear

761.sun: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
761.moon: Although it’s too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet’s sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.
761.name: bounsweet

762.sun: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
762.moon: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.
762.name: steenee

763.sun: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
763.moon: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.
763.name: tsareena

764.sun: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
764.moon: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.
764.name: comfey

765.sun: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran Trainers.
765.moon: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
765.name: oranguru

766.sun: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
766.moon: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.
766.name: passimian

767.sun: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
767.moon: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.
767.name: wimpod

768.sun: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
768.moon: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.
768.name: golisopod

769.sun: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
769.moon: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.
769.name: sandygast

770.sun: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
770.moon: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.
770.name: palossand

771.sun: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
771.moon: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!
771.name: pyukumuku

772.sun: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
772.moon: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.
772.name: type: null

773.sun: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
773.moon: Upon awakening, its RKS System is activated. By employing specific memories, this Pokémon can adapt its type to confound its enemies.
773.name: silvally

774.sun: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
774.moon: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.
774.name: minior meteor

50774.sun: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
50774.moon: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.
50774.name: minior core

775.sun: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
775.moon: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.
775.name: komala

776.sun: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
776.moon: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.
776.name: turtonator

777.sun: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
777.moon: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.
777.name: togedemaru

778.sun: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
778.moon: A lonely Pokémon, it conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokémon.
778.name: mimikyu

779.sun: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
779.moon: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder’s shell is no match for it.
779.name: bruxish

780.sun: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
780.moon: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.
780.name: drampa

781.sun: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
781.moon: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.
781.name: dhelmise

782.sun: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
782.moon: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.
782.name: jangmo o

783.sun: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
783.moon: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they’re regrown.
783.name: hakamo o

784.sun: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
784.moon: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.
784.name: kommo o

785.sun: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
785.moon: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
785.name: tapu koko

786.sun: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
786.moon: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.
786.name: tapu lele

787.sun: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
787.moon: The guardian deity of Ula’ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.
787.name: tapu bulu

788.sun: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
788.moon: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.
788.name: tapu fini

789.sun: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
789.moon: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It’s said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.
789.name: cosmog

790.sun: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
790.moon: There’s something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.
790.name: cosmoem

791.sun: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
791.moon: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.
791.name: solgaleo

792.sun: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
792.moon: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
792.name: lunala

793.sun: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
793.moon: One of the Ultra Beasts. It’s unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.
793.name: nihilego

794.sun: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
794.moon: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.
794.name: buzzwole

795.sun: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
795.moon: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.
795.name: pheromosa

796.sun: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
796.moon: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.
796.name: xurkitree

797.sun: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
797.moon: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.
797.name: celesteela

798.sun: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
798.moon: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.
798.name: kartana

799.sun: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It’s one of the Ultra Beasts.
799.moon: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.
799.name: guzzlord

800.sun: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
800.moon: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.
800.name: necrozma

50800.sun: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
50800.moon: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.
50800.name: ultra necrozma

801.sun: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
801.moon: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
801.name: magearna

802.sun: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
802.moon: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.
802.name: marshadow

803.sun: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
803.moon: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
803.name: poipole

804.sun: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
804.moon: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
804.name: naganadel

805.sun: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
805.moon: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the bruteâ€™s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
805.name: stakataka

806.sun: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. Itâ€™s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
806.moon: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponentsâ€™ surprise to rob them of their vitality.
806.name: blacephalon

807.sun: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, theyâ€™ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
807.moon: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
807.name: zeraora
